alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 06 at 2:29PM CDT until April 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING... .A very dry airmass will remain in place across southwestern into portions of central Nebraska and points east Friday. Southwesterly winds will increase Friday afternoon to 15 to 25 MPH, with gusts up to 35 MPH. The combination of wind along with minimum relative humidity of 15 to 20 percent, will produce critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ FRIDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR SOUTHWESTERN INTO CENTRAL NEBRASKA. The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from 1 PM CDT /noon MDT/ to 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 206 Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest, Fire Weather Zone 209 Loup Rivers Basin, Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin and Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * TIMING...From 1 PM CT (Noon MT) through 8 PM CT (7 PM MT) Friday. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower to middle 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires which may develop, have a high probability for rapid spread and will be difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest
